snippet: Recent developments have created a sense in Albany that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, once poised to approve hydraulic fracturing in several struggling New York counties, is now consigning the practice to oblivion.
abstract: Gov Andrew M Cuomo's administration is reversing its course on hydraulic fracturing in New York State and is not approving process in several counties as expected, but is starting the regulatory process over; decision, which some say means the end to fracking in New York State, is garnering praise from environmental groups and stirring anger among industry executives and upstate landowners.
lead_paragraph: Recent developments have created a sense in Albany that Gov. Andrew M. Cuomo, once poised to approve hydraulic fracturing in several struggling New York counties, is now consigning the practice to oblivion.

headline.seo: With New Delays, a Growing Sense That Gov. Andrew Cuomo Will Not Approve Gas Drilling
headline.main: Shift by Cuomo on Gas Drilling Prompts Both Anger and Praise
headline.print_headline: Shift by Cuomo on Gas Drilling Prompts Both Anger and Praise

keywords.value: Joint Landowners Coalition of New York
keywords.name: organizations
